intro: Filetia bracteosa, commonly known as the bracted filetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
